can take a non-typical image file (so not a jpeg or a gif). So

It's taken a bit less than a day for me and a couple hours for K (he had to fiddle a bit to enable uploading psds) and it's not going to be a lot longer. Will put this to pending in an hour or so with full instructions.

So - example in the /Temporary/banner test folder, to see,
http://www.london2012.com/temporary/banner-test/my-psd-banner.php

To reproduce:
- Create a new page with the 'banner download' template
- upload the preview picture (one that appears on that page) to the same directory as the page
- create a subfolder called Downloads (name hardcoded) for the actual assets (psd/indesign/etc)
- upload the actual asset -with the same name- (just different extension) to the download directory
- edit the page - add the preview picture to the preview box
- and publish everything.

When the page is viewed live, the php will show the preview picture (say test_image.jpg) as usual, and if
- there's a download directory AND
- in the download directory there's a file with the same name but different extension (eg test_image.psd) there, it changes the download link to that one.
- otherwise it jsut lets you download the preview picture (like before)

I've nearly done it. But I can't upload the indesign files - and I
can't actually SEE the error... (it's only a 3mb file)

Hi guys
 
We are looking to patch Web03 with the latest Redhat patches –we need you to do a sanity check of the server once BT have done the patching.
 
They initially suggested to do the work this evening, but I have stated this is too short notice – is there any chance you can do the checks tomorrow evening?  I’ve attached the schedule...
 
Please let me know your feedback – I’ll be back in the office at 3pm.
 
 
Kindest Regards.
 
Jagdeep Singh Bhambra
Jag, when you say "tomorrow night" could you be specific about when? Thanks.
Jag has requested this be done at 7pm.
Jag, I can confirm that we will be available at 7pm tomorrow. Could you please add a comment to this ticket confirming who our main point of contact will be. Many thanks.
Kieran, remember to add 0.5 day (or more if you spent longer) for your work on investigation and reporting the logs issue, before closing this ticket.

Completed work.

1. Devise test plan, in order to be able to check web03 once patches have been applied. (Kieran & jamie).
2. Investigate (unrelated, but nevertheless urgent) problem whereby logs were being stored in /apps/apache. Communication with Jagdeep/IPSoft/BT regarding this issue. (Kieran & Jamie).
3. Sanity-check web03, according to above test plan, 8pm-9pm. Assist Amit fixing two small issues (one of which was related to (2.)). (Kieran).

Total .75 Kieran. .25 Jamie = 1 day.

Clicking on 'reset password' means that I receive an email with a link that simply takes me to the usual login screen. Am I doing something wrong? Thanks Paul ________________________________ From: Alexandra Brown Sent: 09 April 2010 15:00 To: support@postcms.zendesk.com Cc: Paul Jennings Subject: FW: Your London 2012 password Hi all My colleague Paul is having problems resetting his CMS password. When he clicks on the link below it takes him to a login page rather than a page to reset his password. Thanks Alex From: Paul Jennings Sent: 09 April 2010 14:58 To: Alexandra Brown Subject: FW: Your London 2012 password ________________________________ From: London 2012 [mailto:registration@london2012.com] Sent: 09 April 2010 13:37 To: Paul Jennings Subject: Your London 2012 password Hello from London 2012 You have recently informed us at the London 2012 website that you need to reset your password. You can reset your password by following this link: http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/servlet/LoginHandler/rV4UY4tn81LO. For security reasons, this link will stop working once you have reset your password. After that, you can log in here: https://www.london2012.com/settings/login.php. We hope you continue to enjoy our website and hearing about plans for the London 2012 Games. Best regards, The London 2012 team. www.london2012.com If clicking on the URL does not take you to the page to set your password, you may need to copy and paste the full URL below into the address bar of your browser. http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/servlet/LoginHandler/rV4UY4tn81LO
This email message has been scanned for viruses by Mimecast. Mimecast delivers a complete managed email solution from a single web based platform. For more information please visit http://www.mimecast.com

It looks to me as if you did the following:

Requested a password reminder at 1:30pm.

For some reason (perhaps the above reminder did not arrive?) you requested a second password reminder at 3:15pm.

The link that you mentioned in your bug report (the one ending with "LO") was in the reminder sent at 1:30pm. When the second reminder was sent (at 3:15pm), this first one was then invalidated.
Did another reminder arrive, after 3:15pm? And - if so - does the link in this email (ending with "5t") work?
Kieran

Hi Paul.

No Your doing everything right..

Just looking at what is going on here..

Jamie

Yep - did reset my password. But when I go to log in, it still doesn't
accept it.

 

Let me know if you get a fix

 

Thanks

 

 

________________________________

I haven't made a full investigation yet, but it appears that you have two CMS accounts.
One named "pjennings" and another named "Paul.Jennings".
I think that if you log in as the latter, it should be ok.
If you have forgotten the password for that account, then please click the "reset password" link, but specifying a username of "Paul.Jennings" rather than "pjennings".
I hope this makes sense?
Kieran
Billable, but small.

Kieran says: "If this is the Flash uploaded, then this is kind-of a known problem. 
(just about to hunt down the relevant ticket)."

Can you please lead me through the issue step-by-step, Liz? I've just checked it on ie8 and seems all fine.

But Kieran might be right, it can as well be a flash uploader issue. It was raised earlier and I put together a couple of questions (as it can be caused by many different things) - the answers i received that time weren't detailed enough to go further. 

- Is it only happening only with specific files or every file?
- Does it fix itself if page is refreshed?
- Is it only happening on one computer?
- If not, the following questions for all the affected computers:
- Browser type and version (Help | About)
- Flash version (Go to http://kb2.adobe.com/cps/155/tn_15507.html and copy the version number it says)
- Is there any antivirus / adblock software installed on affected computers?
- Is there any proxy settings set up in Internet Explorer? (ie do they
have anything set up here:
http://windows.microsoft.com/en-XM/windows-vista/Change-proxy-settings-in-Internet-Explorer
)

http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/651
Windows + IE7 was (for me) the last working platform for the Flash uploader.
Janos, I'm presuming your tests were using the Flash uploader, rather than the simple uploader?

It's all pictures, on all browsers, on everyone in the offices machines.
And no, it doesn't fix itself. I can't upload any photos.

 

You hit the upload button, and you can see the blue 'progress' bar show
the file is uploading. Then it's done, but the lightbox is still open.
If you close the lightbox, nothing has happened. The file isn't there.

 

We have two different proxy settings currently in use - to be fair we're
having all sorts of strange problems with them and IT at the moment. We
do have one computer that has an outside and there is a DIFFERENT
problem!

 

That problem is that (in both IE 8 and firefox 3.6) if you click on

Is it possible for me to export the entire user database (email and first name only) from the UMS interface? Or is this something you have to do? This is for our mail out on Monday morning. I would like everyone but only once.

There is a link on the UMS home page that says ‘Export all subscribers’ but I am not sure if that relates to the Communicator integration or not.

Grateful for your thoughts!

Morag - as you may know, we have an always fresh (updated daily) database of confirmed users in communicator corp (contact table named UMS Contact list). It, among other things, has first name and email in it.

If we also need unconfirmed users (who may or may not want to receive emails), that's probably Kierans desk.
Also, there is no reason why the export tool in the CMS should not work and if it doesn't we want to know about it, so please do try it and let us know if you have problems.
Marking as solved.

Alex, I have had a look from my own computer and cannot replicate the problem. However, I think it is quite likely to be due to a slow-loading (or even stalled) image file.

If--as is quite likely--this is due to your own network at Canary Wharf, then maybe we shouldn't be too concerned (As it shouldn't effect other users outside the building). If, on the other hand, it is due to 2012 servers being slow, then this would definitely be a concern.

Please let me know if this continues to be a problem.

Update: ignore my previous response. The problem appears to be that some of the images are coming through to us in this state. It seems to  be only the occasional image and as we run the feed every hour, problem images are soon overwritten by a new image. If this continues to be an issue then it might be worth pursuing it with the people supplying the feed. [Thanks, Lars!]

Postcodes are a required field on registration so all users should 
have one (there may be some exceptions as I think there was a period 
when it wasn't compulsory)

Jamie
Sorry Finn, I missed the "NW1 and NW8?" bit off the end when I read the email.

Heh, no worries :-)

 

Any news on how long this might take?

 

________________________________
Finn, do you want "all users" or just those who have subscribed to a specific mailing list?
Sorry to chip in, but is it not just a filter on the database imported from the UMS in Communicator Corp?

Morag reckons we can actually, hadn't realised. I'll get back to you if
we don't have any success, thanks guys

 

 

________________________________

It's a bit trickier than it sounds, as you'll need to find a way of including 
 NW13AA & NW11AA
but EXCLUDING:
 NW112AA
I have already done this export for you, and can send it to you as soon as you've replied to:
> Finn, do you want "all users" or just those who have subscribed to a specific mailing list?

Thanks Kieran, if you've got it there I'll gladly accept the saved time
:-)

 

All users please

 

________________________________

Er, who's "saved time". Has Liz authorized this yet? (four of us have had a look at this ticket now and it's unlikely to be billable). Never mind. We are getting there!

'ASAP' does not mean anything unless Liz or Morag have authorized it.

I haven't sent anything yet.
Why do you think it's not billable?
Important to note that if they do it in Communicator, they'll get incorrect results.
Finn, are you SURE that you want email addresses of people who have not subscribed to any mailing list?

I thought you meant only people from specific mailing lists as opposed
to all mailing lists. No, we don't want to email people who aren't
subscribed to any list.

 

________________________________

I have marked this as billable.
This ticket was flagged as "ASAP today", so I thought it wise to address immediately. If this is NOT the case, then it would help if customers didn't decorate their ticket titles with such flags!
NB fwiw, 0.1 is now an underestimate, as I've just had to make another change.
Delivered via email.

Haven't received this Kieran?

 

________________________________

Odd; I sent you two emails at 15:52 this afternoon.
Will resend now.

Thanks Kieran, both have come through now.

Were there no NW8 registrations at all then? Spreadsheet only seemed to cover NW1-7


-----Original Message-----
Og crikey - I'll go and check now.

Side note: Janos has explained to me how to use the communicator interfaces and we should really not be getting these requests after this week. I am running a training session at LOCOG on Monday after which I am hoping they will start using the tools properly. Getting this data out should be trivial for them (I know, because I just tried it for the first time yesterday).
Re. side note: Did you see my comment re. NW1 vs NW11 ?

I went for something along the lines of  'begins with' nw8 or nw1 and 'does not begin with' nw10 and not nw11. Admittedly, this won't catch anyone in NW1 who has entered their postcode without a space in the middle, but there weren't very many of those, I think. I got 1332 subscribers in total.

Incidentally, there is a 'town' column which looks something like 'LONDON NW1', but is very incomplete. It looks like some kind of lookup has been done on it, but not very consistently.

We can suggest to them that we do some work in order to parse the postcodes.
We have a routine for doing so, that uses the "official" postcode regexp.
i.e. we can add two new fields to the user object:
  outcode (the first 2, 3, or sometimes 4, characters).
  incode (the last 3 characters)
which we populate when the user updates their profile.
They would then be able to search against this field in communicator.
My estimate is one day's work (my bit is prob just under a day, + Janos will need to change communicator stuff).
Worth suggesting to them?

Morag says the rows filled in with a 'Town' like "LONDON NW1" is a hangover from the data collected before we were involved and are no longer being used.

Morag and Finn now seem happy with the Communicator tools and are likely to use them from now on. 

We can probably mark this as solved.
Marked as solved.

Hi Morag, 

Quick update..

Have just chased eCommera for a test XML/RSS feed as we really need to get start on this soon if we are to have something up and tested in time.

thanks

Jamie

--

Hi Guys,

Just thought I catch up on the shop and next steps (technically)

As we discussed we're expecting to receive/parse an XML file (ie an RSS feed) on a daily basis that associates 'tags' with 'products' ie. something like this (not concerned about exact format):

<products>
	<product tag="homepage" gbpPrice="1.25" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Official pin</product>
	<product tag="potd1" gbpPrice="4.25" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Umbrella</product>
	<product tag="potd2" gbpPrice="8.00" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/346" >Pen</product>
	<product tag="potw1" gbpPrice="34.99" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Tee-shirt</product>
	<product tag="potw2" gbpPrice="32.00" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Tea cup</product>
	<product tag="Diving" gbpPrice="3.50" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Diving pin</product>
	<product tag="Running" gbpPrice="3.50" url="shop.london2012.com/showproduct/345" >Running pin</product>
</products>

Where potd1-4 / potw1-4 are the product of the days / week respectively, I'm not hung up on the names here, but it would be nice to have some kind of fall back products to show? Open to suggestions here / happy to go with whatever you offer out of the box.

The other more specific tags that we receive can then be editorially assigned to pages so that certain groups of products are displayed for those pages automatically.

However for Sports pages it would be /much better/ if we both shared the /same/ tags, therefore I have enclosed out Sports, Disciplines and Themes taxonomies.

Would it be possible to get an example of an XML/RSS feed of products (a test feed is fine) so that we can start the work on parsing it / generating the product / testing.

thanks

Jamie

can but it will probably not be until post launch (16th March)
Apologies for any inconvenience."

However, this does not seem to have entirely fixed the problem. I am taking a look to see if I can work out what is going on. If I can find the source of the problem, I will leave a comment here, but I am passing this onto Jamie.
I edited the component: homepage-commercial-partners
I should also add that the XML file that she refers to (http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/images/sponsors/commercial-partners.xml) does not look like it is being used yet.

Final comment before I leave this: although I can't work out how to stop the page shifting up when the logos rotate, inserting some space below the BT logo (e.g. margin-bottom: 26px on the powerdBy id) ensures that the BT logo does not disappear from sight.

Hi Liz,

Apologies on closer inspection the XML file only deals with the Flash 
versions of the rotator, not the normal JS rotator, the values for 
which are hard coded into the component.

I think Danny has updated them all but just checking they match up 
with the paths you have in the XML file.

Jamie

Thanks Danny - I don't understand what file you were editting? I went to the xml file that Jamie put in earlier this change and did that -- taht's all he told me to do! What else was there meant to be?

Just looking at the page now, they Still aren't pointing to the right folder! so the reason nothing has changed is that the photos are identical. are you sure you've changed anything?

 _____

Ah - understood. I don't think the *do* match (on the live site). They're not pointing to the right folder. it should be in the partners-for-homepage

 _____
Liz, I have set this to pending, but if you have further questions, please feel free to re-open this ticket.

Why is it pending? I really don't understand what's waiting to happen? The work you've done, Danny, is having no affect on the live site - clearly something is Wrong.

 _____
Assume this is now fixed and so closing the ticket, if it's not don't bother replying as it will just reopen the ticket ;-)

Registration for London 2012 Open Weekend starts today!

Open Weekend supported by BP is back for 2010
London 2012 invites you to take part in Open Weekend 2010, on 23-25
July. Join us to celebrate two years to go until the Olympic and
Paralympic Games!

Last year over 470 organisations hosted 800 events across the UK; 90% of
organisations surveyed said their event attracted new audiences. Watch
the 2009 celebrations

SJlFrKFs/> 

Be part of Open Weekend in 2010 and celebrate with hundreds and
thousands of people across the UK. This year we are inviting Local
authorities, sporting and cultural organisations and venues across the
UK to set a challenge for the public to participate in. The challenge
could be to create a new piece of art in 24 hours, organise a treasure
hunt or stage a mass aerobics session - it's entirely up to you.

Who can be involved?
London 2012 Open Weekend is open to organisations and venues from the
world of culture and sport. We ask that your event:
- Sets a challenge that the public can participate in 
- Takes place between 23-25 July 2010 
- Is non-commercial and not-for-profit
- Does not have any commercial sponsorship or offer any similar
marketing rights 
- Is open to everyone

How to register your event 
To find out more about this fantastic weekend and to register an event
visit london2012.com/openweekend

SJlFrKFs/> . Registration will close at 12 noon on 16 July 2010. 

Workshops
We will be holding workshops across the UK on how you can get involved
in Open Weekend. Workshops will be held in:
Birmingham - 25 February 
Leeds - 16 March
Bristol - 22 March
Southampton - 26 March
London - 13 April

To book a place on one of the workshops or for any queries regarding
Open Weekend please contact us at openweekend@london2012.com
 .

Best wishes,

The London 2012 Open Weekend team
london2012.com/openweekend

Liz (this came out of getting the Velodrome 'splash' page live with Alex)

Rather than hacking the HTML of the 'splash' page (was 1000 days page) which results in lots of problems / inability for editors to edit it.
http://www.london2012.com/splash/index.html

We wondered if it would make sense to move it into the CMS as an editorial page that you guys can edit / assign pictures and links to in future.

Would probably take a short morning to get done, but would be there for future use.

Obviously it doesn't need to doing now, but if you think it a good idea / want to sign it off please do so ;-)

Jamie
I think it's a great idea!  Only I'm quite certain we're going to change our splash page template in the future, as this one really isn't 'on brand' any more.  So hold that thought....
Jamie, I'm guessing you've set the due date because of Alex's request for a new home page for next week. If so, it might be worth changing the priority to 'high' and billing to 'bill to oda'.
Tackled elsewhere as part of the velodrome lauch splash page
